conclusion: To determine if the particle has returned to its starting point at the 3-second mark, calculate the net displacement using the area under the velocity-time (v-t) graph.
Net displacement is the sum of areas above and below the time axis.
From 0 to 1 second, velocity is constant at 2 m/s.
Area (displacement) from 0 to 1 second is 2 m.
From 1 to 2 seconds, velocity decreases linearly from 2 m/s to 0 m/s, forming a right triangle.
Area (displacement) from 1 to 2 seconds is 1 m.
From 2 to 3 seconds, velocity decreases linearly from 0 m/s to -2 m/s, forming a right triangle.
Area (displacement) from 2 to 3 seconds is -1 m.
Total displacement is 2 m (from 0 to 1 s) + 1 m (from 1 to 2 s) - 1 m (from 2 to 3 s) = 2 m.
Since the net displacement is 2 meters, the particle has not returned to its starting point.
The particle has not returned to its starting point at the 3-second mark.
